intro: Diplotaxis sundingii, commonly known as the Sudanese cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system that allows it to access water from deeper soil layers. Diplotaxis sundingii is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soils, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
